member.name: M:RightpointLabs.ConferenceRoom.Services.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.summary: Marks a meeting as started
member.param: The client's security key (indicating it is allowed to do this)
The unique ID of the meeting

member.name: M:RightpointLabs.ConferenceRoom.Services.Controllers.RoomController.PostAbandonMeeting(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Marks a meeting as abandoned (not started in time). A client *must* call this. If we lost connectivity to a client at a room, we'd rather let meetings continue normally than start cancelling them with no way for people to stop it.
member.param: The client's security key (indicating it is allowed to do this)
The unique ID of the meeting

member.name: M:RightpointLabs.ConferenceRoom.Services.Controllers.RoomController.GetStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Get room status

member.name: M:RightpointLabs.ConferenceRoom.Services.Extensions.TryGetValue``2(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1},``0)
member.summary:
Similar to , but returns the value from the dictionary instead of using an output parameter. Returns default(T) if the key does not exist. This means you cannot tell the difference between a default value and a non-existant key. Do not use this function if you care about the difference.
This exists partially to allow a nested dictionary structure to be easily traversed via
member.typeparam: The key type of the dictionary
The value type of the dictionary
member.returns: The value in the dictionary for the passed key, or default(T) if the key doesn't exist.

member.name: M:RightpointLabs.ConferenceRoom.Services.Extensions.ChainIfNotNull``2(``0,System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary:
If obj is null, returns null immediately. Otherwises, passes obj to chainCall and returns the result.
This essentially lets us fake null propagation. Description: http://kontrawize.blogs.com/kontrawize/2007/03/null_propagatio.html.
member.typeparam: The type of the input object
member.param: The object to be checked for null and passed to chainCall
The delegate to be called with obj as an argument
member.returns: null if obj is null, or the result of calling chainCall with obj as an argument.
